sentences.english: The coffin was carried by six soldiers walking in lockstep .
sentences.chinese: 灵柩由齐步行进的六名士兵抬着。

sentences.english: The coffin was got out of its rough box and down on the snowy platform.
sentences.chinese: 灵柩从粗笨的大箱子里搬出，摆在白雪皑皑的月台上。

sentences.english: The lawyer was sitting in a rocking chair beside the coffin, his head thrown back and his eyes closed.
sentences.chinese: 律师坐在灵柩边的一把摇椅里，仰着头，闭着眼。

sentences.english: Was it possible that these men did not understand, that the palm on the coffin meant nothing to them?
sentences.chinese: 难道这些人真的不理解，灵柩上的棕榈叶毫无意义？

sentences.english: We draped the flag round the coffin.
sentences.chinese: 我们把旗帜覆盖在灵柩上。

sentences.english: It sat on top of a small flatbed with wooden wheels, drawn by the yoked oxen from the field.
sentences.chinese: 灵柩被安置在木轮的平板车上，由上了轭的水牛拉着。

sentences.english: I covered his coffin with the largest.
sentences.chinese: 我用玫瑰盖满他的灵柩。

sentences.english: He stooped and took hold of one of the handles of the coffin.
sentences.chinese: 他弯腰抓住灵柩上的一只手柄。

sentences.english: Her tomb lies in the Museum of Scotland.
sentences.chinese: 她的灵柩现安放于苏格兰博物馆。

definition: to participate in funeral procession/to attend a burial
to keep watch beside a coffin
to attend a funeral/to take part in a funeral procession
a worship ceremony for the dead/to offer sacrifice (to ancestors)/a libation
